p: Samples from two HPeV-positive cases (G001-19/Vic/Jun/19 and G002-19/Vic/Jul/19) presented to the Geelong Hospital in Victoria, were sent to the Geelong Centre for Emerging Infectious Diseases (GCEID) for sequencing. A retrospective analysis was then conducted at the Victorian Infectious Disease Reference Laboratory (VIDRL), Melbourne, Victoria, of all human parechovirus-positive samples collected from sick infants presented to hospitals in Southeastern Australia between February and July 2019. Samples taken by clinicians for parechovirus testing included faeces, nasopharyngeal swabs and cerebrospinal fluid (CSF). Samples were included in this study under ethical exemption from the Barwon Health Research Ethics Committee (Ref No. 16/191). Consent for case descriptions was obtained from families of both infants described in detail as per Barwon Health Research Ethics Committee guidelines. Basic clinical information on all cases is presented in Table 1.
